item.title: Load Balancer vs. API Gateway: Understanding the Differences
item.description: TLDR; Any database falls into one of two category OLAP or OLTP — depending on the access pattern for which it is optimised Key differences: OLAP vs. OLTP The primary purpose of online analytical processing (OLAP) is to analyse aggregated data, while the primary purpose of online transaction processing (OLTP) is to process database transactions. You use OLAP systems to generate reports, perform complex data analysis, and identify trends. In contrast, you use OLTP systems to process orders, update inventory, and manage customer accounts.
